name: Hotel Onda Verde

reviews.text: The Maruzzo Bus Line offers service from Rome to the Amalfi Coast and if you ask the driver, he will drop you off right at the Onda Verdi. This is a pleasant trip and beats having to worry about negotiating the tight, winding roads that sit right on the edge of the cliffs of this breathtaking setting. Getting back to Rome is just as easy, just wait outside the hotel along the main road and when the bus passes, waive to the driver and he will stop to pick you up---(just be sure you have your tickets).
reviews.title: beautiful, idealic setting; friendly, courteous staff

reviews.text: After the bustling hustle of Rome, spending a few peaceful days along the Amalfi Coast is a great way to unwind and relax. The Onda Verde is a well maintained, quiet little place where almost every room has a view (with balcony or terrace) of the spectacular coastline and azure water. There are pathways that lead down to the beach area, which is small and rocky where you’ll find the water is crystal clear, calm and a deep bluish green. There are beach chairs, umbrellas and a small cafe as well as boat rentals. Part of the pathway leads to a stone wall area where bathers can also relax, but there are no chairs in this area, so if you don't mind laying out on a towel you can easily dive right into the water from this perch. If you want to experience the Amalfi Coast from the sea, you can easily negotiate a fair rate from one of the boaters down at the beach. My son and I wanted to do some snorkeling and see Positano from the sea so we spent an afternoon hugging the coastline, diving in the warm water exploring the small grottos, eventually coming upon the idyllic cliffside setting of Positano.
reviews.title: Very welcoming staff!
Lunch on the terrace
reviews.text: The pathways that lead down from the main hotel lead to some very good cafes all of which serve excellent local seafood at reasonable prices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant at Onda Verde serves an excellent breakfast and nothing is quite as peaceful and beautiful as enjoying such a spectacular view watching the local fishermen and boaters start their day living off of the sea. Dinners at this quaint spot are also good but be sure to venture out and enjoy the other spots that are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Outstanding...we're ready to book our return trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nicely appointed...this is not a 5 star resort, so the bathroom is sparse, the bedding is adequate and the amenities are ok, but with a setting so spectacular you won't even miss such things. Onda Verdi is the perfect place to enjoy the beauty of the Amalfi Coast.
reviews.title: fabulous place,wonderful staff,gorgeous views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a one week stay and pictures do justice to the beautiful views, it is that gorgeous. This is the way to visit the Amalfi coast.
reviews.title: Incredible vacation, view , food and service

reviews.text: The service, room and the food were fantastic.
reviews.title: wonderful stay, great staff, unbelievable views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Spectacular locaton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second of our three-part vacation...the first in Tuscany, the third in Rome. Our time along the Amalfi Coast was lovely. The hotel is incredibly beautiful, located on the cliffs of Praiano. The staff was wonderfully helpful...the chef, Nicola and the waiter, Giuseppe were charming. Mr. Milano and his son Francesco were always there to answer our questions and coordinate logistics re: cars, points of interest. We opted for the five-day package, which included tours to Capri and Pompeii. Francesco assisted us in renting a car for the day to tour the area above Praiano and down to Vietri sul mare, where multiple ceramic shops await you. The meals were wonderful (especially after we had a culinary course prior to our stay) and the views at sunrise and sunset were breathtaking.
reviews.title: Warm staff, Lovely views
Hotel Onda Verde is Physically and Spiritually Beautiful
reviews.text: I fully recommend this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

The staff at this hotel make every guest sfeel like welcome family! They are attentive and warm without ever being overbearing. My family had a hard time understanding how this was only a 3 star hotel-- every room has an ocean view, gorgeous linens and comfortable mattresses; the food is fresh, locally inspired and delicious and the location is unbeatable. We were a family of 2 adults and 2 older children and everyone fell in love with Onda Verde! The location is quiet and private and linked up to the larger Amalfi coast towns by a bus stop and water taxis all just a few steps away. We can't think of a single complaint!
reviews.title: Exceeds all expectations for beauty, service and location!

reviews.text: Beautiful family-run hotel offering all that anyone could ever want for an adventure on the Amelfi Coast. Amazing views, delightful food, fabulous wine, impeccable service with many tours on offer for the surrounding area. Last time, like the one before, was so wonderful, heading back with some friends in a fortnight. One not to miss for a true italian experience.
reviews.title: Excited about returning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for four very relaxing nights. The famliy that runs the hotel is friendly, helpful and professional. The rooms were very well appointed and the views were outstanding from every angle. We had not planeed on eating all of our dinners at the hotel but the food was so good and the chef was so good at making special items that we stayed for every meal.
reviews.title: A great place away from the crowds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other great thing about this hotel is that is very peaceful. We spend one whole day each "chilling" at the hotel laying in the sun and enjoying the views. Day trips to all the major areas is easy with the use of the water taxis that the front desk will help you with.
reviews.title: Tranquil hotel with enchanting views & exceptional family run service! RECOMMENDED!

reviews.text: I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in the Amafri coast.
reviews.title: The view was priceless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed with Miro and his family at their Family owned and operated Hotel Onda Verde on the Amalfi Coast in April 2011. After a very interesting train ride, we opted to have Miro arrange for a driver pick us up from Sorrento as opposed to taking the SITA bus that runs from Sorrento to Praiano. The drive is beautiful out to Praiano. Francesco welcomed my husband and I with open arms; we are an young, American, multi-ethnic couple who receives strange looks from some people who do not realize that I am a Ph.D. and my husband also has a professional degree beyond a Bachelors; we're normal, happy, friendly, law-abiding citizens who like to travel the world. Everyone was kind, friendly, hospitable, wonderful to talk to, just really pleasant. The room was wonderful; super clean (I am a clean/germ/neat freak) and I was thrilled. The bed was comfortable - two twins pushed together with a thick pad on top that covered the middle so the gap wasn't noticeable. The bed (letto) had the warmest blankets; we slept with the doors open to the terrazza. We opted to purchase our room with half board, which included breakfast and dinner each day. The food was very good. Breakfast was typical Italian breakfast. Dinner was great! Large selection of seafood caught right there in the Sea and prepared by Chef. We loved the food, wine, service, and company. There are restaurants around the hotel, but we chose to eat with Miro; much easier. We went on the trip to Capri and had a ball. Worth the money and time. The hotel arranges it for you. Great time. One of our favorite things was the silence. It was so quiet, relaxing...not an airplane in sight for days. No loud cars. Just little tiny quiet cars, little scooters, little fishing boats, sea gulls. Perfetto!!!
reviews.title: Hope 2011 is the first of many years for us at the Hotel Onda Verde...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cannot wait to go back. Hat is off to Miro, his family and the Hotel Onda Verde!!! :)
reviews.title: Fantastic find - gorgeous, great staff, delicious food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ***The hotel is extremely remote. We highly recommend if you have lots of luggage or are not good with TrenItalia, have MIro's driver pick you up in Napoli. **Do not try the Circumsuveviana. It could be very confusing or even dangerous if you do not speak Italian. I am extremely good with the Treni, speak Italian, and I was confused by that system. It is not TrenItalia. There were drunks, homeless, very questionable individuals on the circumsu. treno. Professionally we are not who are normally bothered by individuals from various socio-economic stratus, various races, ethnicities, cultures, etc., but this was not very comfortable. We would not allow our parents or children to travel on that treno; put it that way and my Dad lived in Europe for years. We normally travel EuroStar/FrecchiaRossa/Gento; this other treno was more like the worst inner city treno I'd ever seen. Avoid this: Simply have Miro arrange to have you picked up by the company called "Flavio" (Antonino owns it) and all will be ok. We were charged 90 Euro from the hotel to Napoli. Some drivers wanted 120 Euro, Antonino was cheaper. Next time, we will take the EuroStar to Napoli and be picked up there by Antonino, then Antonino will take us back...problem solved. No more Circumsuviana Treno.
reviews.title: Memorable, Peaceful, Friendly, Clean, and OH so Beautiful! Slice of heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is magical. The hotel is built into the side of a cliff next to a tiny fishing village. It's much more warm and welcoming than the scene in nearby Positano. The view is breath-taking, no matter the weather. The staff are wonderful. Be prepared to eat some amazing seafood. The chef leaves trays of homemade treats for guests between meals. We would go back in a second.
reviews.title: Romantic with great ocean views

description: The "Onda Verde" hotel, situated in the heart of the Amalfi Coast, offers an unforgettable stay for nature lovers in search of tranquillity. Like a perfectly set diamond, Onda Verde is in an enchanting location among the beautiful inlets of the coast; 7 km (4.2 miles) equidistant from the towns of Amalfi and Positano. The Hotel boasts an exclusive panorama of the Amalfi Coast; views include the Saracen Tower of Praiano, and that of the Conca Promontory, as well as Paestum, Capri and the Point of Campanella. The hotel is very near the cliffs and the beach. Its facilities and amenities enable guests to enjoy the sea and soak up the sun in the most inviting, friendly and relaxing atmosphere. When each guest arrives, they are greeted by a friendly reception. The Hotel has twenty five (25) private rooms nestled in five (5) mountainside villas as pictured here with bathroom, hair dryer, safety deposit box, minibar, telephone, free Wi-fi connection, satellite TV, air conditioning and breathtaking panoramic view. If you are a lover of beauty and nature, and you wish to watch breathtaking sunrises and romantic sunsets, Onda Verde is the place for you.
